summary: This document is an email chain regarding a revised invoice for parts, involving employees of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions and a recipient at the US Department of Justice's Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It appears to be routine business correspondence related to billing for parts delivered.

persons.name: Luis Diaz
persons.context: Appears as the initial sender of an out-of-office reply, indicating he is on leave and to contact his supervisor. He is a Communication Technician at the US Department of Justice MCC-New York.

persons.name: Margaret Thornton
persons.context: An employee of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions in the Collections department, corresponding about a revised invoice for parts and requesting payment status.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: A Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions who revised and sent an invoice for delivered parts.

connections.description: Work together at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, with Margaret forwarding Justin's revised invoice and coordinating communication about it.
Margaret Thornton's email about an invoice is directed to Luis Diaz (or his department) at the DOJ MCC-New York, as indicated in the email chain.

events.title: Out-of-office reply from Luis Diaz
events.description: Luis Diaz sends an automatic reply stating he is on leave and to contact his supervisor for immediate assistance.

events.title: Invoice review request
events.description: Margaret Thornton requests review of a revised invoice for parts and asks for payment status.

events.title: Follow-up on invoice approval
events.description: Margaret Thornton follows up on an attached invoice, asking if it has been approved.

events.title: Revised invoice sent
events.description: Justin Houston sends a revised invoice for parts that have been delivered.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The correspondence involves the US Department of Justice's Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, which is where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The emails are routine business communications about invoicing for parts between a government facility and a contractor (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions).
The document date (May 2019) is after Epstein's arrest (July 2019) but before his death in custody at the MCC (August 2019).
No direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any associated individuals is made in this email chain.
The document is part of a larger evidence set (EFTA00126281-EFTA00126283) but contains only administrative financial correspondence.
